BOWER.raw_line: Where were you... when Eden was lost? Like every other kid on my block, I was in the middle of a dream, envious of those who were chosen to be part of mankind's greatest quest. Dreaming of the unknown and trying to imagine what only the lucky few would encounter. We PUSH IN towards the cockpit windows and...Where was I... when I heard we'd lost Eden? Just like every other kid on my block... I was dreaming... of being one who would be chosen to follow. As we move closer to the asteroid field of sleep pods, it's obvious that time has passed, a single skeleton inside each of the pods, hands in a clawing position towards the glass. We PUSH IN towards one pod, moving towards the SKULL, still locked in a SCREAMING position, wide mouthed and...Burns are red! Bruises... blue- His voice echoes into the dark, alone in a cavernous room as he pauses, struggling for orientation. He gets to his feet, muscles twitching. His short-cropped hair is... pure white.Hey...? HEY!!? Someone? A constant low RUMBLE is present, joined by the occasional MOAN and CREAK of a large ship. A SHUDDER travels through the room with a random FLICKER of LIGHTS to reveal... A massive steel compartment, tangled with technology. It's cold and institutional. High-tech computer terminals slope out of the floor. The FLICKER passes, taking us into black. We hear him: fumbling through the room, switches are thrown with no result and compartments are pulled opened and... SNAP! A glow stick comes to life. He squints at his darkened surroundings with confusion. A drip of liquid catches his eye and he staggers back to his sleep pod. He grabs the dangling tubes that were ripped from his arm and he sucks on the tube, pulling as much liquid into his mouth as possible. After a few heavy gulps, he suddenly heaves towards the floor. He painfully forces himself to drink, gasping. He looks up to notice two sleep chambers next to his own. He leans closer with the glow stick to see the first one, the name plate reading; 2nd Lt. Cooper. It's EMPTY. The third pod's name plate reads; LT. PAYTON. Deep inside there is the figure of a man, asleep under a mask.Payton? Lieutenant... Payton? He turns back to his own pod, seeing the name plate that reads; CORPORAL BOWER. Even this name doesn't seem familiar.Bower? Bower...? The loss of memory heightens his fear even more as a shiver travels through his body while he staggers towards a nearby computer terminal. He taps the keys on a computer terminal. Nothing. He frowns, leaning closer.Bower. He opens the locker to see an assortment of personalized belongings, uniform and gear, none of it seeming familiar. He uses a towel to wipe off the layer of sweat and oily substance coating his body, pausing to see an identification tattoo on his forearm that reads: FLT>>005Â»015. He pulls on a black flight suit, emblems and military markings of rank on the chest. He pulls on shoes and a tool belt with a high powered pen-lamp. On the inside of the locker is a emergency manual card with block figures displaying breathing and stretching exercises, labelled; Hyper-Sleep Disorientation Recovery Procedures..in the event of mild memory loss... resulting from extended- He freezes on... A PHOTO tucked inside the door. EVALON, a beautiful young woman smiling towards camera. He stares at the-photo, his frown deepening with confusion. He checks the back for a name, but nothing. He tucks the photo into a pocket and exits.Faa-uck! Distant THUMPS. He pans the pen-lamp across the ceiling and toward the sounds... PAYTON'S sleep chamber. THUMP, THUMP, THUMP: Muffled and desperate. CRACK! Bower jumps back as someone kicks their way out from inside, the hatch bursting open. Out climbs... PAYTON, a man in his forties, but the rugged physique of a man half his age, lean and agile. His military-style hair cut is also pure white. Gasping for breath, he hits the floor as BOWER tries to help him. PAYTON jerks with shock.Whoa! Hey... easy! Lt. Payton? You're- Sir... whoa! PAYTON chokes and gasps, then glances up, giving Bower a once over with a frown and a sobering tone.Bower. Corporal... Bower, sir. I'm the-That's right. You're waking fromYes, sir. This is disorientation from-Yes. That's right, I'm-Sorry... sir. PAYTON rubs his face with a frown.We're aboard the Elysium. From what I'veI don't... really know. There's no power in the com and I can't even-I believe so.Sir... I don't know where anyone is. PAYTON takes breaths, trying to regain his senses, glancing around at their darkened surroundings.Ah... we're having some power problems-Umm, not sure. It had to have been the flight computer. There's no one here... .except us.There's no power coming off the main grid. Can't fire any of the... Dynos. Can't even open the doors. PAYTON glances to the other empty sleep-chamber with a frown.Our 2nd Lieutenant? I don't know where he is. It was empty when I woke up. None of the systems are on-line. Mainframe is down, so I don't know how or why it engaged independently-Yeah?Sorry. I just- Just glad to see you awake. i was... a little concerned. I didn't know what to do if- PAYTON gets to his feet, stumbling. BOWER catches him under the arm as they stagger into the wall.Easy... Lieutenant. Easy.I'm on it.This is you, sir.1 It's... the name on your sleep pod, sir. PAYTON opens the door to see his belongings inside, a photo of WIFE inside the door. He stares at it with utter confusion. BOWER takes this in, looking to the memory recovery card inside the locker.it says that the memory loss is only suppose to be a momentary loss that's-I've been awake for at least an hour and I still can't remember my... anything.What was... your last flight, sir?Sir? I know this is going to sound strange, but do you even know where we're going? I can remember the training, but... not the mission. Know the procedures, not the... destination.Didn't even know the ship's name until I saw it-on the console. For all I know this was another damn training exercise-None of the activators are working.Without the mainframe, we can't connect. I don't know how we'll ever be able to- PAYTON is in his element at the control desk, flipping open an emergency auxiliary-power panel. He snaps open a handle and he forcefully gives it several rotations with a MOAN of whirling magnetos. The hand-crank allows a dim glow of electricity to the light panels.Oh, I- didn't even think of that.Five.Team Four suppose to be here for the shift rotation. Where could they be?Where could he have gone? PAYTON gazes off blankly. A RUMBLE of FLICKERING LIGHTS pass and the computer screens slowly fade, going black.Whatta ya think?Somebody... is up there.Jesus. Somebody was trying to get out.Well, he got out... some how. A RUMBLE approaches... another SHUDDER that FLICKERS the lights. They watch the ceiling as BOWER counts in his head as it fades.Cycle is broken.It's not circuitry. Reactor timing is off-set in the core. Seems sporadic, but it's not. Each revolution decreasing before starting over from the beginning.It's trying to reconnect, but it won't until it's reset.I dunno. I can't remember my own- but I know everything there is to know about that damn reactor.And I know that... Another SHUDDER approaches.That's twelve revolutions, before recycling. And this one will only last- As they watch the ceiling, their flashlight beams stop on a small ventilation shaft that's been ripped open. They exchange a look and...Our 2nd Lieutenant must have gone this way. Don't you think?It's the only way out.For what? If the mainframe is off-line-But we can at least find out what'sBut, we can at least try to-Can't do... Sir?You're... claustrophobic?You can guide me... over two-way. PAYTON eyes him over with reluctance.You know there's something wrong. How long can we wait in here before we have to try something?How long did he wait? Silent stare as a SHUDDER passes, flickering the lights.What if no one else is awake and there's no one at the wheel?Yeah... I think so.What do-you remember? Anything yet?And you're the cranky old bastard who made me take the aisle.Nothing yet. Christ, not a single vent opening or- Nothing. How about on your end?Hey? BOWER quickly pushes himself forward reaching an intersection in the shaft.Got an intersection here.A whole lot of the same... nothing.Don't say that. BOWER lowers his head, breathing heavily.I'll be damned. BOWER collects himself, a tightened jaw of determination.I'm taking a left. Make a note.Payton!? Do you copy!? HEY!? Finally...I dunno. I dunno if I can- I can't tell if I'm going in circles or- There's nothing to- Can't breath-I just want... to stand up for God's sakes! Can't breath-Back!? Are you kidding- I can't turn around! I can't even- Do you know how far I've gone!?I just want OUT of this FUCKING THING!I can't... breath!Like WHERE!?WHAT!? Are you fucking kidding me!?What's that?Dream like that, sounds like you've got some... guilt issues.Two years?You said two years. You think we've been asleep for two years?That can't be right.Why would I-leave her? I can't even remember saying good-bye. Why would I?Different... how?Someone's been through here.Someone's been... BOWER notices the droplets of sweat dripping off his chin are rolling forward across the shaft floor with a frown.I'm... I'm at an angle! Shit!No, no... N00000! He slides head first into a vertical drop, the shaft tightening like a funnel, crushing his lungs and SLAM! He crashes into a steel grate where his flashlight lays. It's a nightmarish head stand, his neck twisted with all his weight on top of himself, squirming with no where to squirm.Aaaaeirrrgh!I'm... out! I'm- PAYTON breathes a heavy sigh of relief.I'm- I'm inside a boot locker!I'm inside a God damn- He shoves outward and the door SNAPS open. He falls out, flips through the air and SLAMS to the floor, an IMPACT on the radio sends...Make that an overhead compartment. You with me, Payton? I got out. Hear me? He checks the transmitter, crackling with static.Payton? You there...? He cautiously ventures down the corridor as LIGHTS FLICKER past, getting a quick glimpse of just how incredibly far the corridors run. He steps up to an intersection of corridors, adjusting the frequency on his radio.Payton? Can you hear me!? Dead static. He sighs, looking down each of the corridors, all appearing identical and endless.Which way is which? I He examines the piping that runs along the ceiling, checking the direction of the valves and guesses, picking a direction. He walks to the edge of the next corridor and pauses with a frown. Glancing down the side corridor, fifty yards away, something is off. Within the symmetrical framing of steel, there is a rounded shape that is out of place. Be cautiously steps closer as the object takes the shape of... a MAN, standing at the edge of a doorway, head slightly cocked, peeking out.Hey...!? BOWER freezes, caught in a silent stand-off, the MAN'S motionless stare is unsettling.Hello...? A low RUMBLE approaches as LIGHTS FLICKER past to reveal... The MAN'S face, hauntingly contorted, swollen features. The MAN is dead, hanging from a cable around his neck, naked and gutted like an animal, his feet hanging an inch off the floor. His face is brutally beaten.Jesus... Christ. Jesus- BOWER back pedals with fear and confusion as distant THUMPS make him quickly click off his light and he backs away, fading into the dark. His whisper fades.What-!? He tries to look up and... CRACK! Instant swelling over his eye from a hit. She kicks the envelope opener away.Wait- I'm part of the crew! I'm-I won't! Please! Just listen- I'm not-What!?Alright, alright! Take it easy! He begins to remove his shoes and the radio on his belt suddenly CRACKLES with activity.Stop! Stop it! Listen to me! Hold it! she attacks and he frantically throws dishes and chairs to fend her off. She throws the blade, the blunt end deflecting off his forearm.You crazy fucking bitch- He wields the only weapon he can find... his shoe. And her attack abruptly halts, slowly back pedalling with fright. BOWER is confused, realizing her eyes are looking past him. A BLUISH GLOW seeps in from the doorway, approaching from the corridor. The apparent leader of the pack is HEFLIN, the largest and strongest of the group and he directs the pack with an assortment of odd vocal sounds, deep HISSES from the throat and gargled CACKLES. On command, the one HUNTER flips a lever and the BLUE FLAME crackles back to life with a burst of flammable liquid. The hunt continues, the pack weaving through the debris, following NADIA'S path. And why would they look like that?You should have seen these guys. They were... a very fucked up looking gang. Why the hell would they be-- Payton, they were hunting. BOWER gives himself a shiver as he fearfully checks over his shoulder, eyes shifting with fear.They sure-as-shit weren't a welcoming party from the Promenade deck! Starting with the launch date and time the numbers begin to roll faster and faster. BLIP... BLIP... BLIP.Seems my little memory lapse has finally worn off... "Lieutenant". BOWER slowly approaches, moving closer to his profile, the stream of blood from GALLO'S ear shown running down his neck.Who the hell are you? GALLO keeps his gaze towards the windows, emotionless.You're team four. Why would you... switch bunks? Pretend to be someone else? What would you be wanting to hide? Who the hell are you?You were the one... who first received the final transmission. Who refused to go back to sleep. You stayed awake... for all those years. What were you doing... what crimes were you hiding from when you took Payton's bunk? The time-code display rolls faster, years rolling into decades... BLIP, BLIP, BLIP.Is it true? What have you done to us? Where are we now? GALLO lazily nods towards the windows.And that makes it okay? To play God?Judgement will come for you. You think you could cover it? Your victims survived. Evolved. That's your creation out there. Your crime. BOWER jabs the gun into his back with force.And you thought you'd be able to hide it? Who would ever suspect that? Who would ever remember? I remember. NADIA rubs the glass with her hand, squinting into the darkness. The time-code display rolls faster, decades into centuries... BLIP, BLIP, BLIP.Shut-up.Shut-up!There will be law... in whatever world we create. And you'll pay for what you've done. Believe me. GALLO chuckles with his face pressed to the floor.What is it? GALLO looks up with a blood-soaked grin.What do you see!?We've been... down here... all this time!? All this... time-Hold on! Under the roar of the rushing water, hydraulics ignite. Micro-jets FIRE and WHOOSH! The pod launches, shooting down a tunnel until they're HIT with a tremendous JOLT. They are sent spinning into a wild tumble as bubbles and gas erupt across the outer surface. BOWER and NADIA slam into one another as the chamber turns end over end. Its roll seems to slow for a brief moment and BOWER squints toward the porthole to see...1 Put it on!Hey...? Hey? She chokes on the air and struggles to orientate herself, looking up to see him gazing down at her, coated with bright sunlight.

PAYTON.raw_line: Who are you?Corporal?corporal... Bower.Wanna get that fucking light out of my eyes, pal?Where... are we?Where's the... rest of the crew? It's our shift? Our rotation-Aren't they suppose to be here... to wake us?Hit the lights, will ya?Who woke you up?Cold in here. BOWER grabs him a towel and water container, turning back to see PAYTON doesn't waste any time, stretching his limbs.Bower .Until I have two coffees you're just gonna have to repeat all this shit, so let's just idle here for a bit.Coffee?Good man. BOWER helps him to the locker room as LIGHTS FLICKER past.How do you know that?Very reassuring. I guess when you gamma the brain into extended REM, sometimes it can take a while to get it back. PAYTON pulls on his flight uniform and squeezes his feet into his shoes. BOWER notices the identification tattoo on his forearm, partially obscured from view; FLT>>00... . Unlike his own, PAYTON'S tattoo is faded with age.Listen, the last time I crawled out of a hyper bunk, it took me... quite a while to get it all back. BOWER holds his frown as PAYTON squeezes his finger into a wedding ring.I've gone through this before. I just can't remember why I would agree to do it again. PAYTON goes to close his locker and BOWER motions with a serious tone.I figured you'd tell me.Trust me, it's not. if this is a simulation... PAYTON notices both of their reflections off the mirrored panel inside the locker... revealing their WHITE HAIR.Someone is taking the joke a little far. He shuts the locker and they exit, the flashlight's beam panning away, taking us into darkness.Figures. We can ride two hundred thousand tons of space freighter across the galaxy without a dent in the hood, but can't get one good cup of coffee. PAYTON flips a few switches with no result of power.Payton on the con. Respond? This is Lt. Payton of flight Team...? Shit-Five? How do you know that? BOWER pulls up his sleeve, exposing his tattoo ID. PAYTON nods, "good thinking."Lt. Payton of Flight Team Five. Does anyone copy? Anyone... respond? Anyone awake up there? Dead static.Fucking teamsters. Maybe they couldn't get to us. BOWER eyes the third empty sleep-chamber.The power systems must be free-floating off blown circuits or something. The over-ride grid won't even lock in.I think we need to find a deck of cards and call the union. Distant THUMPS are heard overhead and they freeze... watching the ceiling with uncertainty.Hmm. Ventilation... maybe. Systems keep re-booting after each surge. That could be anything. THUMPS fade as the ship eerily MOANS and CREAKS.I say we get out of here. I'd rather be up and out then stuck in the trunk. The room is blocked by the two heavy steel doors on either end, security doors ten feet wide. PAYTON leads the way towards one end, gesturing towards the doors.We're not far from the bridge but without the circuits locked in... I don't know how we could ever get this thing open. As they approach, their flashlight beams pan across the door to see jagged chips and scratches all along the edges. Tools are scattered on the floor, the control panel ripped open.Ironic. I think it was built to protect us.What?How the hell do you know that?The training stuck.Now if we only had a monkey and a rope. PAYTON climbs down as BOWER rotates his jaw with eagerness.Must have.I think we're better off... waiting here-We're not going to be able to get to the bridge or even be able to open that door from the other side-Do you remember just how big this ship is, kid? We don't know where that will come out, if at all-Listen, I have to take a handful of Doxitol just to get in the hyper-bunk.I can take a lot, that's not one of 'em.Just in case... .there's mail you need to open quickly. BOWER tucks it into a zipper pocket and his photograph falls out. PAYTON watches as he tucks it back in and zips up.Wife...?Must be newlyweds. How can you forget something like that?Some pieces.Give it some more time, pal.How we doing?Power surges keep coming across in longer increments, just like you said.I'm gonna keep trying to get inside and run a dyno. Or at least try to get a pizza delivered.What are the choices? The light pans to endless shafts in each direction. He SNAPS a glow stick to life, letting it drop down the vertical shaft... silently into nothing.If you're gonna take a turn let's keep track. That way you can get back if there's no way out.If you haven't seen anything yet... maybe you should head back now. BOWER sets his jaw and suddenly spots a SPIDER, gently dropping down from a string of web. It lands and quickly scurries away.Left it is. BOWER turns the corner to follow the spider's path, the glow of the lamp slowly fading.I'm here. You alright? BOWER rubs the sweat from his eyes, anxiety increasing with his heavy breathing.Easy, pal. Breath easy. Listen to me- BOWER squirms, pushing outward against the walls of the shaft with an increasing panic.Calm down. Listen, you gave it a shot. Let's get you back here.Take it easy- BOWER bangs the wall of the shaft with desperation.Bower? BOWER!? Stop it. Stop it! Just listen to me. Put it out of your head. Stop moving and breath. Listen toPut your mind somewhere else-Well... this may not be the best time to tell you, but I got the door open.Yeah. I'm kidding you. BOWER lowers his head with exhaustion and a chuckle.There ya go. Now just breath. Easy, pal. Easy. We'll get you through this. We'll figure this out together. Hear me? I do remember something.My dream. On the way out. Real doozy. There I was at the Rose Bowl game. Naked and everyone was drunk but me. Spent two years looking for clothes. Long fucking Rose Bowl game. BOWER chuckles, his breathing growing more steady.Or just... clothing issues.Huh?What can't be?Well, you aren't here on default. This was a select pick. This flight was... different.We're not just doing speed laps on the belt. This was something... special.We were... heroes. We were-What? He pushes himself closer, squeezing between pipes for a closer look..What's wrong?Bower!? What happened? Bower!? All he can hear is the muffled, panicked struggle. The RUMBLE of a power surge approaches.Bower!? Answer me! BANG, BANG... BASH! He breaks the vent and kicks until he's able to push his legs through, into darkness, scrambling.Bower...!? Through the static comes a HOWL of victory.Jesus, don't scare me like that! Where are you?A what!?Bower...? You alright? BOWER!?Bower? Do you hear me? Bower...? Nothing but STATIC.Bower? You there?Bower? Can you hear me?Bower? You there-? BOWER lunges and they go into a violent spin, crashing over a table. Dishes clatter, gasps and grunts... only glimpses of the fight through the flicker of light. CRACK! BOWER'S hit, sent flying and he looks up to see her silhouette approaching, edged weapon in her hand.Is that you!? Bower-- BOWER frantically flips it off as one of the HUNTERS suddenly turns back..with that marking, she's got to be part of the passenger manifest. Possibly a glitch in the LFS support system, a breakdown in the main grid must have woken passengers, instead of the flight crew.Look like what?Hunting!?Take it easy-You're assuming there is someone on the bridge.If they're in there... why haven't they thrown the security hammer into lock down? Seal and freeze it until the emergency units wake?Either way we can't assume help will be coming. On-board or off. Out here, there is no rescue. There is no turning around. This thing wasn't even built... .to return. He pauses off the involuntary memory relapse, looking to the I computer screens, taking in the thought.This is no regular transport. We're not out collecting data off the belt or hauling cargo... we are the cargo. It was a single launch trajectory for... That's as far as his memory allows, his words trailing off.What?Hold it, hold it! Think about this for aNo, listen to me! LISTEN! You know how big this ship is and there's no way of knowing exactly where- If you go on some wild goose chase to try to find her-And then we would be no closer to getting out of this situation with even less time to regain control of the ship. BOWER stews, wanting to retort, his mind is racing.Our job is to obtain control of this ship. Once we've taken control of the systems, finding them would be easy. Are you hearing me? We save the ship... we can save them all.I can guide you. Find out where you are. Hatch marker. Over the door. His flashlight finds one of the hatch doors and he climbs up the slanted wall to read the marker.Take it. Climbing up the angled furnishings, he searches for any available weapon. He notices a mantel that displays several antique astrological and navigation devices. He spots an antique pistol. He breaks the glass, grabbing the gun, but it crumbles under his grip, falling to pieces. He sighs, but pauses to see... because the furniture is angled, his light spots a hiding spot underneath the desk. He pulls out a silver flask, bone dry. He reaches further, pulling out an unusually shaped weapon, much like a sawed-off shotgun with rounded edges. He snaps open the hand-crank I lever and gives a forceful whirl. A slow MOAN of magnetos causes the weapon's lights to dimly come to life.Alright. I'll lay out a path for you and see if we can by-pass the main security doors.Back toward the flight decks. Back to me.What chance have you got out there on your own? We'll figure out a way to breach the command bridge- A power surge sends a SHUDDER and FLICKERING LIGHTS past...Bower...?You know how to do that?Okay. Hold up. I don't want you to go too far down that lane. Just catch yourI don't know vet. Hold on- BOWER backs to the wall, nervously scanning the corridor, struggling for breath. In the background a SHADOW moves at the end of the corridor.What did you say?Of all things to remember, why would you pick that?No, no, no. You're talking about- Eden was lost because of a mechanical failure,spook story, along with a million others. Eden was mechanical failure, not human error. A. glitch... that was remedied way before we ever-They did that for obvious reasons, not because of Eden. BOWER pauses... within reach of the window only to realize it was an illusion. A glass compartment door left slightly ajar was reflecting a circular light panel, smeared with oil to give the illusion of craters. His shoulders drop in defeat.Who says we didn't? BOWER climbs down, peering out into the corridor.Left at the third marker. Two more levels down and we're there.Why do you say that?Bower, you sure that's a good idea? HeWatch yourself! BOWER hesitates, the flashlight reveals SHEPARD'S identification tattoo through the ripped uniform and blood- soaked bandages. It reads; FLT//006//017Bower, you tell this asshole the chain of command and a direct order to-Get the hell out of there.Bower!? BOWER!? Answer me God Dammit! All that is heard is GARGLED STATIC and PANICKED BREATHING.Don't look back! Hear me? Just go! GO! BOWER finds an open corridor and sprints as... Blades SCRAPE across metal, Blue.torches ROAR, HISSES echo. BOWER gasps heavily, hyper-ventilating as he catches glimpses of HUNTERS on his trail and running parallel in adjacent corridors, closing in with unnatural agility and speed.Dower...? That can't be... you- The SOUNDS remain muffled, deeper within the wall, possibly from inside the ventilation shaft. PAYTON contemplates, eyes panicked. He climbs up the wall and wedges the panel cover over the shaft opening, jamming it closed with a screwdriver. He backs away, gripping the weapon, ready for anything. He tries to control his breathing as he sits... watches... and waits.You want in? Come and get it you fu- The screwdriver SNAPS and the panel hits the floor. PAYTON raises the pipe, preparing to fight and... A desperate gasp is heard from inside the shaft.Who the hell... are you!? GALLO is tightly wedged inside the shaft, squirming to crawl out, trembling with fear and exhaustion.Easy... Easy. You're all right. PAYTON runs to grab a towel and water. As he turns back he notices GALLO'S hip and legs are sprayed with dried blood. PAYTON kneels over him and GALLO spasms from his touch.EASY! I'm here to help you! PAYTON lifts the bottle to his lips, but the water runs down his face, GALLO is frozen in shock.Com'on. Try to drink a little. Here. GALLO is unresponsive, wide eyes locked in a trance.What's your name? Huh? Can you hear me?What's that? Gallo...? PAYTON frowns, mumbling the name with a hint of recognition.Corporal... Gallo?Where did you come from, Gallo?The bridge!? Where are we? What's happened? Can you tell me-Corporal?Tell me... what happened? GALLO is hyper-ventilating, eyes wide with terror. A droplet of blood slowly builds in his nostril, refusing to drip. A low whine is heard in his throat as... LIGHTS FLICKER past.Bower? Do you copy? You out there? Dead static. He sighs and glances toward GALLO, passed out on a nearby bunk. He hesitates, holding the pipe as a weapon, tucking it away and cautiously approached GALLO for a closer inspection.Team Four. Flight Team... Four? He glances up to see GALLO is now awake, staring at him.Just... checking you. GALLO narrows his eyes, pulling the blanket tighter.To make sure you're... alright. You... passed out. You-Payton... Lieutenant Payton.That's right. You're Team Four? You're suppose to be... my predecessor. GALLO deepens his frown, glancing around with disorientation.You said... you came from the bridge? GALLO shifts his eyes back on him, a bad topic.Where are we? I can't get guidance off this system and I have no idea where-Well, what did you see? How did--Easy. I just want to make sure... GALLO'S hands are trembling, uncontrollably..you're okay- GALLO tucks his shaking hands under the blanket, defensively.Is this your blood... Corporal?Whose blood is it? GALLOholds his stare, jaw muscles tightening.Who didn't?i Something was wrong with who?Pandorum. Both of them-?It's just a sedative. Help you relax- GALLO lifts his fists with a threatening posture.Take it easy. We're on the same team here. Alright?What?I've seen it before. But nothing that-I didn't say that-I wasn't about to question any of yourThat's what they say. GALLO slowly rubs his temples, with hesitation.The truth... about what?What transmission? GALLO'S eyes are welling up, his lip begins to shiver.Earth... is gone? GALLO puffs across his hand with twisted amusement.In one day... it had to be nuclear or-?Oh my God...Easy...How could they... how could they have let this happen? PAYTON slides his hands off the keyboard, his finger tips i nearly twitching, an uncontrolled tremble. He tries to hide his hands, sliding them under the console as... GALLO watches him blankly before wandering away to let him sit alone with the horrific realization. PAYTON shakes his head, refusing to accept it.BOWER! I'm here! Where are you?I hear you. How do we get you in there?I think the direct channels are fried. I'm gonna run a patch so we can get this door open as soon as we're back on-line.The bridge. As soon as we're up we'll be able to take control of guidance. But only from on the bridge. GALLO continues pacing, throwing glances toward the empty sleep chambers.He can do it.He's the only shot we have. Gotta have a little faith.What are you suggesting, Corporal?Launching ourselves... into deep space when we don't even know where we are? We wouldn't last more then a few days inside those things. That's suicide-Stand down, Corporal. We're not going to abandon anything and we're not going to leave them behind-I said stand down, Corporal! That's an order! GALLO steps up behind PAYTON, his face revealed with a thin stream of blood oozing from under his nose, dripping off his chin, eyes hollow and pale. PAYTON refuses to look at him, continuing to type.He's in! That's the reactor's activator panel. We're going to make it out ofGallo... you have to listen to me... Carefully. You don't haveâ¢to- GALLO steps closer behind him, his shadowed outline showing an imposing posture, his voice is forced and unsteady.Don't... do what? PAYTON slides his hand further across the console, reaching for the pipe weapon, eyes on the screen.Take it easy- GALLO'S presence is felt behind him, his voice seeming to grow raspier and uneven with breath, anger simmering.Easy...I'm giving you an order....to stand-down... Corporal.Think about what you're doing...This won't work...just think about what you're doing-It wasn't the crew that was sick, was it?What did you really do to them...? GALLO slides into the pod and...For your own good-You're not well, Corporal. You just need the proper treatment-This isn't your fault-Your mind... has turned against itself. GALLO EXPLODES with RAGE... POUNDING on the hatch with a jack- hammer of fists, bones shattering in his own hands. PAYTON ignores his screams, going back to the console and typing I into the keyboard.I My God... he did it! He did it.shut-up.I'll FUCKING CARVE YOU UP! Within the struggle, hands grab at weapons, a wrist is twisted... lining up both of their identification tattoos to be identical... FLT>>004>>012>>. The syringe is stabbed into skin. The trigger fires liquid, injecting the chemical into someone's arm as their voices converge, over-lapping at first and becoming one voice...

NADIA.raw_line: Keine Bewegung!Don't you move MOTHER FUCKER! She quickly pats him down, stealing tools. All he can see is her bare feet, blackened from oil. He frowns to see her toe- nails painted with bright pink polish. NADIA, a torn jump suit, snarled hair hiding her face, skin smeared with oil. A beautiful woman underneath an apocalyptic smear of grunge. Her hair is pure white, high- lighted with smears of oil.Take them off!SHOES! I'll gut your ass-You're... part of the flight crew?I didn't think there was any flight crew left. What's happened to us?Gee, you think? Where are you going?You just wake up?You'll never make it.You're going the wrong direction. She grimaces and turns, heading back up the corridor. BOWER and TANAKA exchange a look. BOWER chases after her.Nobody.Team? Why would I want to join?To the reactor? No thanks. Don't like going that fax down. No one ever comes back. She continues up the corridor and BOWER grabs her arm. She yanks away from his touch, squaring off, weapon in hand.Can you fly it?Can you fly it... if you have to?Don't know. There's no way to tell time in here. Two... maybe three months.Quiet! You wanna get us killed!?Longer. I wasn't the first one up.i Shush! We're waiting.Quiet! At the far end of the corridor, a faint BLUISH GLOW grows stronger. Shadows are moving, growing closer.Ssssht! The HISS and CACKLES of the HUNTERS grow closer and it seems they're shortly going to be cornered and done for until... A SHUDDER is felt, a FLICKER of LIGHTS approaching. She goes to a control panel, holds down a switch and presses her palm F across a scanner. As the power SURGE passes, the control panel activates, scanning her hand and the steel door activates with a MOAN of hydraulics. BOWER notices her ID tattoo; BIO-T>>218>>076.Never quite felt like sticking around to find out. Running... is always the best option. Believe me.Ecological Development, Embryonic Charter. Livestock and wildlife re- population. The rows of glass tubes are labelled, ranging from mountain goats to octopi, everything a new world would need.You couldn't remember?It comes only in pieces. Even after a few months. I know everything about this vault and its systems... but I still can't remember where I grew up. Or my brother's name. Only pieces... And the training comes back first. For good reason, I guess. BOWER eyes the darkened computer terminals, portions of the consoles coated in algae.Dehydrated meatloaf. House special. I save 'em for the weekends. BOWER sniffs it with a sneer and tries to break off a piece... hard as a rock.Do you know how long it would take to turn dehydrated meatloaf into that?I don't know, but it takes more then a couple years to turn coal into fucking diamonds.This ship was built to outlast our children's children... and any engineer could tell ya the warranty is running out. I think we've been asleep longer then you may think. BOWER tosses the orange brick. to TANAKA and he sniffs it with a grin, breaking off a piece. NADIA finishes gathering tools and she slings the bag over her shoulder, "ready to go".Who the hell is there to call?We can't get through this way.It's the safest way to travel. And there's only one other way to get through that I know of.Main corridor. Hyper-sleep chamber, Personnel. Keep your light down.Keep quiet.Keep moving.What does she do? What's her specialty?Then she's not in here. This is development settlers. Engineers. NADIA quickly continues as BOWER tries to keep up.We have to keep moving. We don't want to stay out in the open for too long. Especially in here.We can't stay herel NADIA heads across the main floor and BOWER tries to wave him on, but TANAKA is locked onto something, refusing to waver.Then you wait... and find your own way.I told you I'm not going to wait. I'm not gonna get myself killed for-What do you think he's doing in there!?He's hunting! Bagging the next notch on his belt. You wait for him! Good luck. I NADIA quickly heads deeper into the room and down a darkened and narrowing tunnel. BOWER hesitates with frustration. Having to choose, he turns and chases after NADIA. I They crawl through a maze of machinery and NADIA'S pace is difficult for BOWER to keep up.Run.Run!Shut-up! They listen for a long moment... hearing nothing as BOWER looks at his hand, finger tips trembling.You want to go back?We should go back. Find a different path. I don't think we can get through to the reactor bay from-I'm ready to explore other options-You really want to discuss it here!? A RUMBLE is heard approaching and they all crouch in unison. It's a power surge that sends FLICKERING LIGHTS across the massive corridor and a BLINKING LIGHT is activated on a nearby sleep-chamber. And then... BANG! The hatch door is KICKED from the inside, white gas erupting from the seam. Our gang quickly crawls toward the shadows, crouching behind equipment to watch as... Another KICK bursts open the hatch and a BIG PASSENGER crawls out, slamming onto the floor with a shiver of agony, gasping for breath, muscles twitching.What are you doing-!?We gotta find a way out.I was trying to get us out of there alive-I was trying to save our asses-I didn't need to help you at all! You and the Hong-Kong Express would still be playing ding-dong-ditch on level eight if it weren't for me! Their heightening confrontation is halted by...I don't know. Gotta be somewhere below B- deck.No. That's... not possible.Or something that was already on board, with us in the hyper-bunks.It's the only theory I can come up with. The synthetic enzyme in our feeding tubes. The accelerator that would help our bodies adjust and adapt to the environmental conditions on Tanis. From what I've seen... these things have adapted... to the ship instead.I don't know. Like I said, it's the only theory I can think of- Unless...Could that be real? You think that could-He was- He was gonna fucking eat me!He gassed us! He was gonna- All of us! LELAND is appalled, spitting out the breathing tube.What is that?What does that mean?Done!? What do you mean done? What do we do? Hey!?What are you talking about? You said you could reset the reactor- That we could- That there's a chance to-We weren't meant to go back! We were meant to go on. And now it's more important then ever! We're the last of-What about your duty? What about... your wife!? There's still a chance she's-You don't know that for sure!stop it! STOP IT! Are you crazy? It's just a child!My God. They're... breeding.There's no where to turn back to. We can't give up-You didn't tell us anything. You never said that. You said you'd love to come-What are you doing? What is it?You think she's... here?How do you know for sure? She could be-Well, then... she saved your life. BOWER frowns on the thought, slowly nodding in agreement. His eyes look to the label of the chamber he was led to, the label reads; M. PAYTON. He mumbles to himself, memory returning.you... knew her?Who's... Payton?Hurry! Go! BOWER turns back to the panel, flipping more switches and continuing the process as the reactor begins to HUM as...Bower...?You snake bastard- OPEN IT!Where's... your lieutenant?NO!? Are you crazy-I What are you doing!?No! I can't- Not like this! I'm not going to wake up and drowned-

GALLO.raw_line: Help... me! PAYTON pauses, angling the light inside to see... GALLO, a young flight officer, boyish innocence, short-cropped hair, heavily coated in sweat, desperation in his eyes. His hair is dark brown, the only person without pure white hair.Help me- I'm part- of the flight crew! I'm- Please- HELP ME! PAYTON oddly hesitates... before lowering the weapon. He digs into the shaft grabbing GALLO'S hand, pulling him out. GALLO collapses onto the floor, crumbling into a fetal position, naked. His hands are locked in claw-like grips, trembling uncontrollably. His gasps are rapid and unsteady.The... bridge. Saying the words seems to send him into a terrified trance.What are you doing?For what?Who the hell are you?Lieutenant? You're... a lieutenant?I don't know.Listen, I'm not a navigator. Stars all look alike. I don't know! How the hell would I know!? Sensing GALLO is about to break down again, PAYTON tries a calmer approach.I'm fine. PAYTON lowers his stare, hesitating, glancing across the dried blood still splattered across his legs.Some of it is... sir.They didn't give me any choice.There was something wrong with them.It was... Pandorum. Of the worst sort. They were- I couldn't even- I had to defend myself.You don't believe me?What are you doing? What is that?Then you take it... and relax. PAYTON backs off, setting the syringe aside.If you would have seen them... you would have done the same thing... sir. LIGHTS FLICKER past...Do you know the symptoms of Pandorum?Orbital Dysfunctional Syndrome. Pandorum. Ever witnessed the symptoms of first-hand?It's not something you can easily detect. Starts with a shiver. An itch. A slow boil... and without being able to get off the ship... there's no shutting off the heat. It'll boil over, no matter what you do. GALLO is slowly pacing the room and PAYTON watches him with uneasiness out of the corner of his eye.You don't believe me.How could they both have had it? The odds are insurmountable.But, we all know Pandorum is greatly affected by any substantial psychological It has an emotional trigger effect.How do you think you would react... if you knew the truth?we were only into our second term. All flight systems nominal. I'd picked up on symptoms with my CO and 2nd Lieutenant. Mild symptoms. Nothing I thought would... become a problem. Until we got the transmission.The final transmission. The last message... from home.You are that's left of us. Good luck, God bless... and God's speed.Wiped away. We ran a full sweep off the grid and they were... gone. One day there, the next... nothing.Whatever it was, they knew it was coming. Wished us well. We're all that's left. PAYTON sits back in shock, shaking his head in disbelief.You can see why I was hesitant... to tell even you. My fellow crew members didn't take the news too well. I wanted to wake the primary crew... but my 2nd Lt was already over the edge.ODS came through with flying colors. No logic, no reasoning left. No future, no past, no hope. A dangerous mix when you're stuck inside a tin can like this. The blow was more then he could handle. My lieutenant wasn't far behind. Pandorum.They were my commanding officers. Men who had guided me through FT. I looked up to these men. But... it wasn't them anymore. They... were gone. They... tried to... I had no choice. I- With his body beginning to tremble, PAYTON tries to console him, touching his arm. GALLO flinches.What are you doing?What's so important on the other side of the door?This ship is not dying. PAYTON refuses to look to GALLO, continuing his work.It's already dead. You really believe that kid will be able to save this ship?Twelve hours ago, he didn't know his own name. Now, you think he's ready to re- configure a nuclear reactor?Faith? After what you know now, you can actually say that with a straight face? A little faith? THAP. A droplet of blood hits the floor at GALLO'S feet.He's right about one thing. Once that thing shuts down, we're as good as dead. Nothing on this ship will ever turn on again. Ever. Not the air, not the lights, the heat... not even the pod's escape launch systems. PAYTON refuses to look up from the computer.I'mï¿½saying... once it's done. We're done. But, we still have a way out of this... before it's too late.We can still launch ourselves in the pods. Before the ignition systems are completely dead, sir.A few days is better then what we have left here. I'll take my chances. How long do you think that reactor has been sitting? That thing could melt-down when he tries to fire the core. This ship could be ripped in half-We can't stay on this ship. You know that as well as I do-Trust you? How can I trust someone who isn't even honest with himself. Tell me? PAYTON refuses to acknowledge him, continuing to monitor the control panel. He discreetly slides his hand closer to the pipe weapon as he senses GALLO'S presence behind him.Don't do that. TRAP... TRAP... THAP. Blood drops hit the floor heavily.Don't talk to me like some child that needs reassurance. Think I don't know the risks? Think I don't know this ship?I know this ship and what she's capable of better then anyone. I know her... and I know what she can and can't do.And this... she can't do! Why are we even arguing. You know it-You wanna stay here to die, that's your choice, not mine!Who's being irrational here, Lieutenant? Tell me? Who's being delusional!? Hmm? PAYTON raises his hands, calmly submitting.I'm getting off this ship. My flight's over. OVER! Another panel on the console begins to gently blink as...Shut-up. GALLO jabs the syringe gun towards the back of PAYTON'S head while putting one foot inside the pod.Finish the code...Let me out. I can... help. PAYTON ignores him, typing rapidly into the keyboard.I'll help you! Please- I can help! PAYTON runs over to the security door and hits a switch on the sensor. The door doesn't react.What are you doing? You can't- You're trying to get on the bridge? PAYTON runs back to the console, typing into the terminal.You don't want to go in there, Corporal. PAYTON throws him a glare, continuing to type in commands as the room erupts with activity.Where do you think you're going?Think about what you're doing, sir-You don't want to see what's in there-We both know who needs this shot...Who's the one suffering... sir-Corporal... PAYTON slams him against the wall, making him older.Your mind... has turned against itself,I was younger then you when I first came on board. Funny, I can't even remember what it was like... before this flight began. It's all I know.Go ahead. Take a peek. You tell me. BOWER hesitates, looking toward the darkened windows. He stays with the weapon on GALLO as NADIA wanders toward the front control console, towards the glass. With the lights fading on the weapon, BOWER gives the lever a quick whirl, motioning the barrel closer.You think God survived? He's gone... with the rest. There's no one left to judge you, Bower. NADIA approaches the glass, squinting towards the heavily smudged glass. She frowns, trying to wipe away the layer of sludge.No world left. No law. No order. Only us. You the law now? You gonna be the one that brings order to what's left? Wanna take a shot at it? I did my best with what I was given. Wanna be King for a day? Give it a whirl, Corporal. I'd like to see how you fare. With the laser sights fading on the weapon, BOWER quickly cranks the power lever, keeping the gun raised- A slow grin spreads across GALLO'S face as he finally looks to him, revealing the thick streams of blood that have dripped from his nose, coating his chin and neck.Try to imagine it. Imagine... yourself for five minutes without morality. I'll bet you'd surprise even yourself, kid-Imagine... us both. What's left to stop you? I offer you the kingdom and you-There's still quite a few sleeping beauties down there... a thousand flavors. You up for a little window shopping?I wanna see it. I'll bet you'd be aA real boy scout, is that it, kiddo?You ready for the new world, corporal? BOWER keeps the gun on him as he goes to the windows. NADIA has a ghostly expression, unable to speak. BOWER leans toward the glass, squinting into the darkness and... SWISH! An object moves past the outside of the glass. He leans closer, squinting to see... a school of ALIEN FISH dart past. The shin is underwater. BOWER staggers in shock, back pedalling as GALLO continues to chuckle.I guess this thing does land itself. Just doesn't float too well. BOWER lunges towards him and GALLO is ready for this one, quickly countering his move and SLAMMING BOWER into the console. He unleashes a vicious BLOW into BOWER'S throat. BOWER collapses, choking for air and GALLO kicks the gun away. He kneels over BOWER, slowly pulling out a blade.My apologies. Ladies first... of course.What is a King... without his Queen. He hits the control panel switch and...
